children.subject: Please see this post if you're an L&S student. If you're in EECS, you should contact your ESS Avisor for a form.

[CPT] Too late to enroll in cs 197

Hi, Advisors: 

I just reached out a program with some tech companies. However, for Berkeley cpt process, I need to enroll in cs 197 but it already passed Sep 12th. Can I still enroll in cs 197? If I cannot what can I do? I spend so much time in career fair and job search online, I do not want to miss this opportunity. 

Thanks for helping me.
As this is a college policy and process, it would be best to ask them. However, I think that if it's your first time falling below 13 units, they will give you a warning and process the drop
Would I still be allowed to late drop a class if it would put me at 12 units (L&S)

history.content:
Effective Fall 2017, L&S changed their policy for requests to make late changes to student schedules. Students are now allowed to request for late changes (adds/drops/change units in variable courses/grading options) once in their entire undergraduate career at Berkeley. 

**The deadline to submit this form to 206 Evans with major advisor signature (if declared) is November 30 at 4PM. Declared students must use CalCentral to book an appointment with a CS advisor or attend drop-in hours on Wed, 10-12PM & 1-4PM in 315, 375, & 379 Soda. Undeclared students do not need a major advisor signature, but we recommend speaking with one prior to using this option. We cannot see students outside of drop-in hours on Wed without an appointment so please plan ahead.**

 

1) L&S Students are allowed to request for late changes (adds/drops/change units in variable courses/grading options) once in their entire career at Berkeley. (one semester)

2) Students can request changes to up to 2 courses in that one semester on the same petition.

3) Exceptions granted prior to Fall 2017 do not affect your possibilities to do late drops, everyone started fresh. 

 

If this is your first request, it will be granted. However, you should use with caution. Future requests (should you get sick, have a family emergency) will not be approved.

For more information and to request a late change, please see this form: https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/latechangeclassschedule_fa18_1.pdf
